description: Presentation of OS metrics collected from Metricbeat. Also including logs for correlation with logs from filebeat.

options.content: Resolution is $interval. This means that graph shows a metric for each $interval. The default resolution is "auto" which sets resolution to chosen time interval divided by 40, but you may set a manual value above. Note that resolution affects things like 'min', 'max' and 'current' values since these are based on metric values in the displayed graph. Combining a low value for resolution together with long time range will also consume much memory in your web browser and take long time to render.

panels.title: Per process RSS memory - usage (bytes) by cmd

title: OS stats - Linux
